back.text:
Root: ل ه و (L-H-W)
Meaning: Diverted you, distracted you
Pronunciation: Alhākum
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'هَا'.
Derived Words:
1. لَهْو (Lahw): Diversion
2. لَاهِيَة (Lāhiyah): A diversion
Example Ayah: الَّذِينَ اتَّخَذُوا دِينَهُمْ لَهْوًا وَلَعِبًا

Root: ك ث ر (K-TH-R)
Meaning: The competition in worldly increase, mutual boasting
Pronunciation: At-Takāthur
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Shamsiyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'كَا'.
Derived Words:
1. كَثِير (Kathīr): Many
2. كَثْرَة (Kathrah): Abundance
Example Ayah: This word is unique to this Surah in the Quran.

Root: ق ب ر (Q-B-R)
Meaning: The graves
Pronunciation: Al-Maqābir
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'قَا'.
Derived Words:
1. قَبْر (Qabr): A grave
2. قَبَرَ (Qabara): He buried
Example Ayah: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُ فَأَقْبَرَهُ

hint.text: The destination that ends the distraction.

back.text:
Root: N/A (particle)
Meaning: Soon, later
Pronunciation: Sawfa
Tajweed Rules: **Layyin** on the 'سَوْ'.
Derived Words: As a particle, it has no derived words.
Example Ayah: وَسَوْفَ يُؤْتِ اللَّهُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ أَجْرًا عَظِيمًا

hint.text: A word indicating something that will happen in the future.

back.text:
Root: ع ل م (ʿ-L-M)
Meaning: You will know
Pronunciation: Taʿlamūn
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'مُو'.
Derived Words:
1. عِلْم (ʿIlm): Knowledge
2. عَالِم (ʿĀlim): A scholar
Example Ayah: وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

Root: ي ق ن (Y-Q-N)
Meaning: Certainty
Pronunciation: Al-Yaqīn
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'قِي'.
Derived Words:
1. يَقِنَ (Yaqina): He was certain
Example Ayah: وَاعْبُدْ رَبَّكَ حَتَّىٰ يَأْتِيَكَ الْيَقِينُ

Root: ج ح م (J-Ḥ-M)
Meaning: The Hellfire
Pronunciation: Al-Jaḥīm
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'حِي'.
Derived Words: This noun is primarily used to describe Hellfire.
Example Ayah: فَإِنَّ الْجَحِيمَ هِيَ الْمَأْوَىٰ

Root: ن ع م (N-ʿ-M)
Meaning: The comfort, the blessings
Pronunciation: An-Naʿīm
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Shamsiyyah** and **Madd Tabi'i** on the 'عِي'.
Derived Words:
1. نِعْمَة (Niʿmah): A blessing
2. أَنْعَام (Anʿām): Cattle
Example Ayah: فِي جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ

hint.text: The subject of the final questioning on the Day of Judgment.
